WRITING.TEXT: Now I don't like this game.
I like this game.
Seahawks fans should just be happy it's 13-0, instead of 21-0 like it could be.
This is reminding me a lot of Niners-Saints 2011.

I never wash jeans.
If you work a blue-collar job where your jeans get dirty and beat-up, this is bad. You really need to wash them to preserve the fabric, or it'll wear through pretty fast. Holes in jeans might be trendy, but not if you need them to stay intact for work.
Well, fuck it, I wasn't going to be sober today anyways.
I just can't decide who to hate more.

The underwear one is goddamned blasphemy.
And yes, I am single.
A good reminder of just how much an armored division wasn't actually tanks.

An orchard near me lost several dozen bottles in a hurricane one year.
"Lost"

WRITING.TITLE: Reddit, what mispronunciation of a word bothers you the most?
"Review a web site" HIT, by Tina Hill - are these a scam?
WRITING.TEXT:
Supposedly $1.75 for 5 minutes work, but I can't actually submit the HIT - the "Submit" button doesn't work. Given the nature of the work, it looks like they're just trying to generate click-throughs to ads.
Anyone else?
Here's the HIT:
https://www.mturk.com/mturk/preview?groupId=3ZAK6NWIY2J4B1BCW8CLUDIC41Q9VM

WRITING.TITLE: What's a good substitute for egg as a binder?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm looking to cook up some packaged salmon (it was on sale - don't judge me!) into salmon cakes.
So, what can I use to hold it firmly into a patty shape instead of egg? I'm not allergic, or anything, I'm just kind of tire of the taste and texture, and looking for an alternative.
Also - is buttermilk good for frying up salmon cakes? I was just going to go with flour breadcrumbs, but it's not chicken ... so I wasn't sure about using buttermilk to fully batter.

WRITING.TITLE: Sen. Rand Paul thinks Eric Garner was killed ... by taxes.
A short stroll up the Pacific Crest Trail, on a somewhat rainy day - Northern California.
Winter
Parallels - Railroad tracks, corn fields, power lines, and then some random mountains in the California Central Valley.
These large snowflake like patterns froze into the mud of my driveway.
A very wicked looking stalagmite in an ice cave.
House investigating committee finds no intelligence failure before Benghazi attacks.
Something a bit more recent - the hotel register in Chester, California, on the day nearby Lassen Peak erupted, June 1914; [2848x2136]
Lassen Peak, CA, on a grey day. [OC][2592x1944]
Can I make cranberry mustard from dried cranberries?
WRITING.TEXT:
I have a big plastic jar of a vaguely trail-mix type of stuff, including a lot of dried cranberries ... which I don't like. But I really like both cranberry sauce, and especially cranberry mustard (pref. the Beaver brand). So can I turn what I've got but don't like, into something I have and do like?
Because I have feeling it's not quite as simple as "mash them up and add them to mustard."

WRITING.TITLE: Sunset from I-5 in northern California, near Willows. [OC] [1998x1475]
This snow fell onto, and then corkscrewed around, a round guardrail.
No, Pandora, that's probably not the right album cover for this song.
Will the mortar I mixed yesterday still be usable today?
WRITING.TEXT:
I was mixing a bunch of Type S mortar for brickwork, but got interrupted, and left it overnight with about three inches of water sitting on top of the mixed mortar in a bucket. So it hasn't been exposed to air, and is still quite soft ... but has anything essentially changed in sitting wet for so long? Is it still properly usable mortar?
Or should I just toss it out and start over, wasting nearly half a bag?

WRITING.TITLE: Were there ever any efforts to issue patents of nobility in the English-founded American colonies?
WRITING.TEXT: Like, say, creating a Duke of Maryland, or an Earl of New York. Seems like it'd be the usual thing to do, but I can't recall hearing of it. Land grants were handed out, but no titles to go with them - it would've especially made sense in the case of someone like William Penn, where you'd almost expect at least a Baronetcy to be granted.

WRITING.TITLE: Redditors, what is the one thing guaranteed to make you nostalgic?
WRITING.TEXT: Be it a scent, a fragment of song you catch in passing, whatever - it randomly occurs, and just takes you back.

WRITING.TITLE: Two brothers crossing America in a biplane.
WRITING.TEXT:
I can't remember if it was a TV show or made-for-TV-movie, but in any case, it was about two brothers (IIRC) crossing the U.S. in a refurbished old biplane. Fictional, not reality show - this would've been the very late '80s, with a somewhat patriotic theme.
For some reason I associate it with the 1976 Bicentennial, but watched it in the late '80s on broadcast TV.

WRITING.TITLE: Old nature documentaries, maybe from Disney.
WRITING.TEXT: If you were a kid in the '80s, you know what I'm talking. Slightly grainy, muted-color nature documentaries narrated by a guy with a slightly backwoods accent, and a tendency to treat the animals like people. You know, "Old fox here, he might've missed out on catching himself a rabbit today, but there's always tomorrow."

WRITING.TITLE: Major California Reservoir Levels
This Fourth of July, will you be a tourist, or will you be avoiding tourists?
Why were up quarks detected so much earlier than Higgs Bosons?
WRITING.TEXT: By my vague, addled understanding, the barrier to detecting particles is mass. The higher the mass, the more energy you need to detect a particle. So why was the up quark detected by the relatively low-energy SLAC in the '60s, but the Higgs took until less than two years ago to detect in the *much* higher energy LHC?

WRITING.TITLE: What does "tech [number]" mean when it comes to defensive line positions?
WRITING.TEXT: Because I haven't been able to come up with an answer via Google. Which positions are associated with which "technique #s"? I understand what each DL position *does*, it's just this specific terminology I don't know about.

WRITING.TITLE: What was your High School mascot? Was it at all unique?
WRITING.TEXT: Because I really, really doubt there's another school out there that goes by "Volcanoes." Well, maybe in Hawaii.

WRITING.TITLE: What basic, easy to learn skill do far too many people not have?
iPod Shuffle will only play 30 minutes of a track.
WRITING.TEXT:
I have an old 3rd generation iPod Shuffle. I like to load up lectures onto it to listen to while I work - problem is, once a file hits the 30 minute mark, the iPod skips to the next track.
Is this a common thing? Can anything be done about it?

WRITING.TITLE: If you had a dollar for every point of your karma, what's the first thing you would buy?
Do we have any contemporaneous works by the great writers of ancient Greece and Rome?
WRITING.TEXT:
Not in their own hand, of course ... but when it comes to people like Horace, Virgil, Tacitus, Cicero, etc., do we have any copies of their works that were published either in their own lifetime, or shortly after?
Because I've always wondered if we're just relying upon copies of copies of copies of copies, and so on. Were the humanist scholars of the 14th Century just copying Carolingian documents? Or did they have original material from Roman and Greek times?

WRITING.TITLE: Is there a completely full-screen program for writing available?
WRITING.TEXT:
I don't want menus, scroll-bars, or whatever.
I want a perfectly black screen with a cursor ... and *not a damned thing else*.
Does such a word-processing program exist?

WRITING.TITLE: Is there a word processing program out there that allows actual full screen?
WRITING.TEXT: And yes, I have Open Office, which still surrounds my so-called "full screen" with a bunch of toolbars and brightly lit margins. I want a black screen that I can knock text into, like something Smith Corona made in 1993.

WRITING.TITLE: Any suggestions for balancing out the flavor of canned spinach in a quiche?
WRITING.TEXT:
So I'm going to use some canned spinach in a quiche to up the vegetable quotient ... and while I usually like it, it has a very mushy "green" taste to it, if you know what I mean.
Is there something I can to do balance this out? I was thinking spiciness to cut into the blandness - maybe some chopped jalapenos, and some Sriracha. Other thoughts?

WRITING.TITLE: My neighbors cut a hole through a snowhill with their snowblower.
The front of a ruined bank in a ghost town in central Nevada. [OC] [1971x2624]
Volcanic hazard map for Lassen Peak, California. [752 x 417]
Before Activision was known for Call of Duty, Earthworm Jim, or Tony Hawk.
Why is "salty" suddenly a thing on reddit, as an adjective? Not food related.
WRITING.TEXT:
Especially on /r/nfl, I think. Basically people saying things like "I was salty as fuck about that call."
Its reddit use doesn't really seem to match the UD definition.

WRITING.TITLE: An actual cowgirl - on a horse and everything.
Nap time.
What does "doe" mean? Is it just a play on "dae"?
WRITING.TEXT:
Because I'll occasionally see it as a response, like:
doe?
I have the feeling it's a painfully obvious acronym, and I'm going to feel very stupid when it gets explained.

WRITING.TITLE: Droppin' trees like a motherfucker.
Fuck it, I'll start.
This is now a thing.
WRITING.TEXT: So ... have at it.

WRITING.TITLE: An old fireplace and chimney next to Hwy. 36 outside of Westwood, California, with a forest fire in the background. [OC] [2136 x 2848]
A license plate in an old Ponderosa Pine.
Gamefly downloader doesn't work - I've got nowhere to sign in.
WRITING.TEXT:
So, I installed the latest version of the Gamefly Downloader, as it's the only way I can re-download a game I had a while back. Only ... I can't do a damned thing with it.
This: http://i.imgur.com/VLa0E5j.jpg is what it looks like. Maximizing the window just leads to this: http://i.imgur.com/JLiTN1Q.jpg which is, of course, no better. There's just no way to sign in.
I've disabled Adblock on my browsers, as recommended by their support FAQ, but still nothing.
If I can't fix this, does anyone know of an alternate way to download from GameFly?

WRITING.TITLE: Lassen Peak on a cold day. [OC] [2592 x 1944]
One simply walks into Mordor.
Is it possible to set a reserve price after making a listing?
WRITING.TEXT: Didn't see it in the initial options, so didn't set a reserve price. I'm starting to regret it - can anything be done?

WRITING.TITLE: Where else can I download the Armageddon Mod?
WRITING.TEXT:
For some reason, I simply can't connect to moddb.com. Any alternatives?
Also, is the broken single-player campaign fixed in later versions? I have v. 3.3000, and am aware there's a newer version.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone know the IPs for wikipedia's various domains?
WRITING.TEXT:
Looks like I'm going to have to add them to my hosts file, because my ISP's DNS is crap.
There are plenty of whois tools online, I know, but it seems to be kind of a crap shoot as to which are free and functional, and which you have to pay to get info from.

WRITING.TITLE: [Request] What to do with a cornish game hen.
WRITING.TEXT:
I bought a frozen cornish game hen sort of randomly, and now I'm wondering what to do with it. All the recipes I've seen are very ... bland.
More importantly, I thought about stuffing it with wild rice before baking - is there anything else non-bready that I could add to the stuffing? Not real big on cranberries, so what else could I go with?

WRITING.TITLE: The zombie apocalypse just started. How does this make your life better?
WRITING.TEXT: "The Walking Dead" style zombies, not the "WWZ" nightmare-fuel zombies.

WRITING.TITLE: Are there any good online sources for original documents from the Middle-Ages?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm talking scans or pictures, not transcribed. So much of what we know seems to have come from letters and journals - are there any good archives of these? Preferably in English, any other language and I'd just be seeing examples of handwriting.

WRITING.TITLE: Why shouldn't I force thaw raw shrimp?
WRITING.TEXT:
The package of cheap, Costco-purchased, tailed raw shrimp from Vietnam says to thaw only by leaving for a while in the fridge, and specifically says to not force thaw under cold water. It doesn't mention microwave thawing or going straight to frying from the freezer at all.
Any particular reason why not?

WRITING.TITLE: Accurate [Fixed]
Two broad questions - one regarding two stroke engines, one regarding tractor engines.
WRITING.TEXT:
First - is it really a bad idea to use starter fluid in a two stroke engine, especially if the starter fluid has a cylinder lubricant?
Second - Is there such a thing as 10W-30 for diesel engines? The cap on my Kubota says "10W30D," but I use Delo 15W40.

WRITING.TITLE: "Thomas More" by Holbein the Younger [823 x 1024]
How to make grape leaves less bitter?
WRITING.TEXT: I tried making dolmas a few months ago, and while I enjoyed the filling ... the bitterness of the grape leaves was just too much. Is there anything that can be done about it?

WRITING.TITLE: [bug] Images not expanding to full size when thumbnail+ is clicked on.
WRITING.TEXT:
When I click on a thumbnail with a + sign, the images no longer expand to full size right there on the page. I have to (*quelle horreur*!) actually click on the link to open an image in a new tab. The + changes to a - without anything anything happening.
I've changed absolutely no settings between when this function still worked, and when it stopped working.
- RES Version: 4.3.0.4 - Browser: Firefox - Browser Version: 24 - Cookies Enabled: true - Platform: Windows

WRITING.TITLE: Image harvesting software?
WRITING.TEXT:
I know these used to exist, but I'll be damned if I can find one.
I'm basically looking for a program that will download all images on a site within a certain sub-address. Not something for fuskering (I'm not looking to raid personal archives on Photobucket), but for sites that just have a lot of linked images, even some subreddits here - like, say, downloading a few months worth of pictures from /r/EarthPorn, without having to sit there and right click for hours.

WRITING.TITLE: What song do you feel starts off and continues great for a while, but then just overstays its welcome?
A girl riding a buffalo at a rodeo.
How dated are the works of Will and Ariel Durant?
WRITING.TEXT: I absolutely love what I've read of *A History of Western Civilization*, but I'm wondering if I should bother with the earlier volumes. I'm concerned they may have been drastically outpaced by new scholarship, especially "Our Oriental Heritage," which was written in the '20s. I'm not concerned by volumes like "The Age of Voltaire," which was not only written much later (the '60s), but about a more recent and better documented era.

WRITING.TITLE: What are the creepiest song lyrics that aren't actually intended to be creepy?
WRITING.TEXT:
Because "He looked to be about sixty, and maybe I was ten, my momma would whup me but I'd go see him again" is way up there.
So, what other ones?

WRITING.TITLE: What song do you hate purely because of the memories it brings up?
Anyone else ever place this old version of Duck Hunt?
WRITING.TEXT:
I don't even have pictures of it.
Anyways, back in the mid-80s (young people can go ahead and just leave now), a local pizza place had a billboard-style game on one wall. It was about 6' x 3', and was played with an IR remote.
There was a illustration of a hunter holding a shotgun standing in some reeds with a dog, and there were five cut-out positions for the shotgun. They'd light up individually as you directed with the controller. The ducks were also lit up sections of an otherwise black panel, and you'd have to have the gun aimed at the right angle to hit one.
Anyone else remember this?

WRITING.TITLE: So ... just imagine it's the offseason one year from now. What will you be posting about?
The mountains of central Nevada in the early fall. [2337 x 1757] [OC]
How does my touch sensitive lamp work?
WRITING.TEXT:
So, I have a desk lamp made of wood and metal.
If it's off, I can touch any metal part and it will turn on. Another touch, it becomes brighter. A third touch, it goes to its brightest. A fourth touch ... it turns off.
There seem to be no moving parts. So what, exactly, is going on here? Are there moving parts inside of the (very small) wooden core, that switch around like those in a car's turn signal?

WRITING.TITLE: Pay showers exist.
WRITING.TEXT: Please use them. Seriously, you can't smell yourselves, but those of us that live in the towns you pass through *can*.

WRITING.TITLE: It's on my shelf, and there's not a damn thing anyone can do about it.
Why are you going to hate yourself in the morning?
Saddle up.
Man throws a spear at random car. With pretty much the mugshot you'd expect.
Third generation iPod Shuffle keeps getting quieter and quieter, regardless of battery strength.
WRITING.TEXT: I have to constantly do factory resets to get it back up to full volume. Is this a common problem? I'll probably move on to the latest iPod Touch this summer, but for now this is really annoying.

WRITING.TITLE: Not sure who's going to win this staring contest.
Wait, which torture scene are we in again?
JaMarcus Russel to try out for Ravens.
This year we got a lot of snow for as usual.
What is the average number of aftershocks for a medium quake?
WRITING.TEXT: Because for the "Greenville" quake, we're up to about 300, a decent number of them in the 3.0-4.9 range. Is this normal?

WRITING.TITLE: What are you drinking right now?
WRITING.TEXT:
Lagunitas Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale, here. About to temporarily switch to water.
The rest of you?

WRITING.TITLE: As a lifelong Californian, that was the first earthquake I ever really felt.
WRITING.TEXT:
Just had a moderately strong one here in northern Plumas County. Everything just shook and rolled for about fifteen to twenty seconds, and I could actually hear the rumble.
Kind of neat, but slightly disturbing, given that an active volcano is less than twenty miles away (Lassen) - I thought it must be erupting.
Anyone got any info?
EDIT: A 5.7-5.9, according to the USGS. Epicenter was about eight miles away.

WRITING.TITLE: Do any foreign authors write books set in the U.S.?
WRITING.TEXT:
Preferably in English. I'm kind of curious as to how right they get things. Also, may as well exclude Canadians.
I'm just wondering if there's like a Russian equivalent of Elizabeth George.

WRITING.TITLE: [OC] Nice spot for a picnic, might be a tad obscure. [National Park]
Burning leaves and deadfall in the evening.
A young spring guest in the yard.
Shasta Dam under construction, early '40s. [847 x 657]
TIL that Teddy Roosevelt believed that American currency shouldn't carry the motto "In God We Trust."
Who is the worst widely read historian, in your opinion?
WRITING.TEXT: Perhaps not strictly following the guidelines of "events prior to the past twenty years," but I feel it fits the spirit of the subreddit. Namely - who do you, professional or amateur historians - consider the worst published writer of history who is fairly well known? Thus excluding revisionist cranks or other fools. First nomination: Norman Davies.

WRITING.TITLE: I actually feel sorry for whatever the hell this is. It has such a sad face.
Creek running through and under ice and snow. [1722 x 2233][OC]

Truth in advertising, aka "This is the only can design they need."
Ridiculously photogenic horse, American edition.
Backyard in winter, Chester, CA
Old chimney in northern Nevada ghost town [2556x1920].
The things you see at a rodeo ...
Blurry picture, fuzzy puppy.
Found in the woods ... a giant horned puffball. I think.
[TTM] Just a simple dandelion in the park.
